title: 820-00164 Not booting fully.
message: This keeps getting stuck on the progress bar. I've obsessively check all of the SPI resistors and traces. Tried a different SPI ROM. I've attached a picture of the area of the board that got spilled on. The spill only hit the U6100 area. It's obvious I have an SPI ROM-related issue, but I'm not sure where to get next with it.

title: 820-00164 Not booting fully.
message: You cannot swap the ROM chip from another board. Was the original ROM ever touched?

title: 820-00164 Not booting fully.
message: When I say I tried another ROM it's always only for testing, just to see if I can get a different response out of the board. I put the original one back after I observed no difference. This board came to me without anyone else working on it. It had a spill and the picture is truly the only part that got hit, it just happens to be right on top off the ROM.

title: 820-00164 Not booting fully.
message:
PRAM reset, booted in single user and fsck -fy the OS?
Booted from external drive?

title: 820-00164 Not booting fully.
message: It could be ME region issues. I do not have a BIOS with clean ME for these. Check this thread and send them a PM [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/11949-macbook-air-2015-board-820-00165-problem-with-loading-osx-after-efi-reprogramed[/url]

title: 820-00164 Not booting fully.
message: Ok, thanks, I think I have one. That's the variable I was trying to remove by testing with another ROM. Assuming that ROM also doesn't have a bad ME, wouldn't the system at least boot up, but run slowly?

title: 820-00164 Not booting fully.
message: You can never swap a ROM and expect it to boot. ME is tied to the specific CPU/PCH on the board. You MUST use a clean ME if you want to test another BIOS.

title: 820-00164 Not booting fully.
message:
I can tell you if it had liquid damage around the SPI then its shafted the bios chip and you need to replace it with a clean ME
Ive seen liquid damage around the SPI cause so many macbook airs to hang right near the end of boot and a reflash on a new bios chip has always resolved it for me.
